result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: no contact with BRB or residence, Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

10:06 AM Defendant LEONARD J. PECORE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz in court for LEONARD J. PECORE.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense filed bond modification.  Remarks by Atty. Fritz requesting case 22CF323 to be modified.  Response by Atty. Parker.  Court grants motion and bond in 22CF323 and amends to $250.00 cash.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant LEONARD J. PECORE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz appeared by video for LEONARD J. PECORE. Defense waives reading of Information and enters NG plea.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:20 AM Defendant LEONARD J. PECORE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Kaupie in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz in court for LEONARD J. PECORE. 
B. Beyer sworn & testifies.  Objection - leading - ADA Kaupie/laying foundation.  Court sustains.  Witness id's DE.  Cross-exam.  Objection - goes beyond the scope of todays hearing - overruled.  Closing arguments.  Atty Fritz argues against bind over - no testimony of items taken.  
Court finds State has met the burden of proof, finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial. 
ADA Kaupie requests 30 days to file information.  Court will allow until June 29 as DE's other cases are scheduled on that day.
Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant LEONARD J. PECORE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz appeared by video for LEONARD J. PECORE. R. Frechette sworn and testifies. Cross by Atty. Fritz. Redirect by State. State move's to adjourn preliminary hearing until witness can be subpoenaed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
